roles.name: Primary Care Physician
roles.description: Provides frontline medical diagnosis, treatment, and preventive care, coordinating with specialists as needed.

meta.typicalBackground: Medical degree, residency in family/internal medicine, licensure, strong bedside manner
challenges: Managing chronic diseases, administrative burdens, short appointment times vs. patient needs

sampleUseCase.scenario: A primary care physician detects early signs of hypertension in a patient, prescribes lifestyle changes and medication, coordinating follow-ups to prevent complications.

roles.name: Public Health Official
roles.description: Develops and enforces public health policies, investigates disease outbreaks, and leads population-level health initiatives.

meta.typicalBackground: MPH or epidemiology training, knowledge of health regulations, crisis management
challenges: Vaccine hesitancy, resource constraints, political pressures in health decisions

sampleUseCase.scenario: A public health official organizes mass immunization drives during a measles outbreak, collaborating with local schools and media to raise vaccination rates and halt the spread.

roles.name: Hospital Administrator
roles.description: Oversees hospital operations—staffing, budgeting, patient flow, facility standards—ensuring quality care and financial viability.

meta.typicalBackground: Healthcare administration or business management, leadership experience, knowledge of clinical workflows
challenges: Balancing cost controls, patient satisfaction, staff retention, and regulatory mandates

sampleUseCase.scenario: A hospital administrator introduces a lean management approach that streamlines admissions and discharges, cutting patient wait times by 30% and improving bed availability.

roles.name: Pharmacist
roles.description: Dispenses medications, counsels patients on drug usage, and ensures compliance with pharmaceutical regulations.

meta.typicalBackground: Pharmacy degree, licensure, detailed knowledge of pharmacology and drug interactions
challenges: Medication errors, opioid regulation, insurance reimbursement complexities

sampleUseCase.scenario: A pharmacist notices a potential conflict between a patient’s new prescription and existing medication, contacts the physician to adjust dosage and prevent adverse reactions.

roles.name: Mental Health Counselor
roles.description: Provides therapy and support for individuals struggling with mental health issues, from anxiety to substance abuse.

meta.typicalBackground: Counseling or clinical psychology degree, licensure, strong communication and empathetic listening skills
challenges: Stigma around mental health, ensuring continuity of care, insurance coverage limitations

sampleUseCase.scenario: A counselor employs cognitive behavioral techniques for a teenager with anxiety, teaching coping strategies that significantly reduce panic attacks and improve school attendance.
